mdRecord.dcterms:title: Officium Beatae Mariae Virginis: nuper reformatu[m] et Pii. V. Pont. Max iussu editum. ; Cui accessit Kale[n]d Gregor. perpetuu[m] / 1590. Apud Societ. Typog. Libroru[m] offi. Eccle. ex decret. Conci. Trident. via Iacobaea
Orationes dominicales et ferials
Petit formulaire de deuotes prieres, et oraisons chrestiennes & catholiques
Petit formulaire de devotes prieres, et oraisons chrestiennes & catholiques
Quinze effusions du sang de nostre sauueur & redep̃teur Iesus-Christ
Quinze effusions du sang de nostre savueur & redempteur Jesus-Christ
Sensuyt la vie saincte Marguerite
Sensuyuent les vespres du dimenche et du samedy
Vespres du dimenche et du samedy
Vie saincte Marguerite
Catholic Church. Little office of the Blessed Virgin Mary
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: Douglas H. Gordon Collection of French Books (University of Virginia)
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Apud Sebastianum Niuellium, Michaëlem Sonnium, Guilelmum Chaudiere, Gulielmum de la Nouë, Claudium Chapelet, via Iacobaea. Ioannem Gorbon, sub signo Cordis boni, in monte D. Hilarij. Et Ioann. Mettayer & P. L'huillier, Typographos & Bibliopolas Regios
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Signatures: ã⁸ ẽ⁸ ĩ⁴ A-Ff⁸ a-k⁸ A-B⁸ A-E⁸ ã⁸ [daggar]⁸.
Imprint from colophon at end of "Orationes dominicales et ferials" (3rd group)

Volume also includes: Orationes dominicales et ferials (78, [2] l.) -- Sensuyuent les vespres du dimenche et du samedy, auec Complie. Pour le dimenche (16 l.) -- Petit formulaire de deuotes prieres, et oraisons chrestiennes & catholiques (40 l.)-- Les quinze effusions du sang de nostre sauueur & rede[m]pteur Iesus-Christ ([8] l.) -- Sensuyt la vie saincte Marguerite ([8] l.)
Text printed in red and black through "Sensuyuent les vespres."
"Petit formulaire" has special t.p. with imprint: A Paris : Chez Guillaume de la Nouë, 1597.

SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Binder: Clovis Eve. Tipped in: two slips stating that the binding has the floral device of Marguerite de Valois, interspersed with the S fermé of her husband, Henri IV. Wilmerding catalogue states that the binding was executed for Pierre Duodo, who was born in 1554, whose arms and device have often been attributed to Marguerite de Valois. Bookplates of Robert Hoe and Lucius Wilmerding. Gordon Collection. Bookplate of Douglas Gordon. Gordon list, 383. A description of the volume, which was laid in, has been placed in the INSERT FILE.
